Speaker.hpid: Minister for Social Welfare (Mr. B. Desmond) Barry Desmond
Speaker.NameTxt: Minister for Social Welfare (Mr. B. Desmond)
Speaker.P: To be entitled to unemployment assistance an applicant must be the holder of a qualification certificate which is a statement of his means. The qualification certificate of the person concerned was revoked in November 1982 on the grounds that in the course of a review of his means he had failed to show that his means did not exceed the statutory limit. When interviewed by a social welfare officer the person concerned threatened the officer and refused to answer queries.

A letter received by the Department on behalf of the person concerned is being treated as an appeal against the decision revoking his qualification certificate and his case is being referred to an appeals officer. It will however be necessary for him to co-operate fully in the assessment of his means and his entitlement to unemployment assistance will then be reviewed in the light of the appeals officer's decision.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Leyden Mr. Leyden
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Social Welfare the reason for the decrease of £2.15 in the social welfare allowance being paid to a person (details supplied) in County Roscommon.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Social Welfare (Mr. B. Desmond) Barry Desmond
Speaker.NameTxt: Minister for Social Welfare (Mr. B. Desmond)
Speaker.P: The person concerned was in receipt of unemployment assistance at £47.65 being the maximum rate payable to him as a married man with one qualified child £50.50 less means £2.85.

His child attained the age of 18 years on 18 April 1983 and his entitlement to an increase in his rate for a child dependant ceased from that date. Accordingly the rate of unemployment assistance payable to him was reduced to £41.10 being the maximum rate payable to him £43.95 less £2.85 and payments at this rate continue to be made to him as they become due.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Molloy Mr. Molloy
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Agriculture the reason for the delay in granting sanction for the sale of 4.1 acres of land in the Mannion estate to a person (details supplied) in County Galway.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Agriculture (Mr. Deasy) Austin Deasy
Speaker.P: Subdivision consent was sought at the end of March and has been granted.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Leonard Mr. Leonard
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Education when the contract for the extension to Three-Mile House primary school, County Monaghan, will go to tender.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. Hussey) Gemma Hussey
Speaker.P: My Department have approved in principle of the extension of Three-Mile House national school, County Monaghan. A site extension is needed and one has been offered by the chairman. The Commissioners of Public Works were requested in March last to indicate, for the information of the chairman, the location of the new building on the site extension.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Bell Mr. Bell
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Education if she is aware of the very serious situation which now exists at Drogheda VEC, County Louth where ten teachers' positions and jobs will be lost this year due to her Department's new regulations which have just been issued; if she is aware that there are 1,400 pupils between two schools on the opposite side of the town which is causing massive administrative problems for staff; and if she will urgently review this matter.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. Hussey) Gemma Hussey
Speaker.P: There is one vocational school, operating in two separate locations, in the scheme in question. In order to facilitate the administration of the school, my Department have authorised the creation of a post of principal separate from that of chief executive officer, the assignment of the principal to the larger section of the school and the assignment of the viceprincipal to the smaller section for as long as the school continues to utilise premises in both locations.

The allocation of teaching staff authorised for full-time day courses in respect of the coming school year represents a reduction of three teachers in the number allocated for the current year. This allocation is in line with that being applied to large post primary schools generally in the context of the introduction from the commencement of the next school year of revised staffing regulations.

Speaker.hpid: Miss Flaherty Miss Flaherty
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Education when the temporary accommodation in the Commons school, Killybegs, County Donegal, will be replaced with adequate permanent facilities for the increasing number of pupils.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. Hussey) Gemma Hussey
Speaker.P: Sketch-plans have been approved for a new school to replace Commons national school. A grant will be sanctioned when title to the school site has been established and when agreement has been reached with the school authorities regarding the local contribution to be provided towards the cost of the project.
